resources.string:
1. Wake on LAN may be disabled by default in your BIOS/UEFI. Consult your motherboard manual, how to enable Wake on LAN in your BIOS/UEFI.
 2. You may need to change your network card settings in your Operation System to enable Wake on LAN.
 3. If you are going to use Wake on LAN to switch on the laptop, be advised that it may require AC power to work.
 4. This functionality only works, when target device is connected via LAN. WLAN is not supported.
